intro: Dicraeia tenax, commonly known as the rock heather, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with dense clusters of small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Dicraeia tenax is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often thriving in high-altitude environments.
